accessibility_text:
# Accessibility

* * *

##### On-site Accessibility

The Block Museum of Art is a fully accessible facility in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). As a designated “Place of Public Accommodation,” the museum offers no-step entry, elevator access to all galleries and levels, wheelchair-accessible restrooms, and designated wheelchair seating in the auditorium.

Exhibition layouts prioritize accessible pathways and meet ADA-recommended height and width guidelines for kiosks and displays. Temporary folding stools are available upon request, and wheelchairs can be arranged through our partnership with Northwestern University’s Department of Accessibility Resources. A gender-neutral restroom has been available since 2016. Convenient drop-off and pick-up access is located directly in front of the museum on Arts Circle Drive. All Block staff are trained to provide accessibility support and foster an inclusive, welcoming environment.

The museum also partners with [AccessibleNU](https://www.northwestern.edu/accessiblenu/) to coordinate interpretation services for live events in the auditorium and galleries, with at least 10 business days’ notice. Large-format printed labels are available at the front desk, and label content is also accessible digitally via Bloomberg Connects for use with screen readers and personal devices.
